Key Match Events: Tyler Holton failed to record an out in the first inning
Reese Olson gave up a three-run homer to Lane Thomas in the first inning
Detroit Tigers stranded two runners in the first inning
Josh Naylor hit an RBI single to chase Holton
Lane Thomas hit a three-run homer in the first inning
Cleveland Guardians rolled to a 7-0 win
Pre-Game Insights: Detroit Tigers came in feeling confident after going 31-13 since Aug. 11 to earn a postseason berth
Detroit Tigers swept AL West champion Houston in the wild-card round
Detroit Tigers manager A.J. Hinch decided not to use a traditional starter in Game 1 of the AL Division Series
Detroit Tigers third baseman Zach McKinstry made a fielding error in the first inning
Detroit Tigers manager A.J. Hinch brought in Reese Olson after Holton's poor performance
Detroit Tigers had a chance to land the first blow but stranded two runners in the first inning
Detroit Tigers had a chance to score against Cleveland's vaunted bullpen but failed to get a runner past first over the final five innings
Post-Match Reflections: Detroit Tigers manager A.J. Hinch said, 'When they punch you with five in the first, it’s hard to overcome'
Detroit Tigers manager A.J. Hinch said, 'The in-between hop is a do-or-die play, and that’s the die part'
Detroit Tigers outfielder Parker Meadows said, 'We have to keep playing our game against them'
Detroit Tigers outfielder Parker Meadows said, 'They’ve been really good all year and we know that, but we’ve been pretty good, as well'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Detroit Tigers' third baseman Zach McKinstry blamed himself for the fielding error in the first inning
Detroit Tigers' manager A.J. Hinch said the grounds crew did not water the field properly before the game
